storyInfo:
Ratatos secretly meets with Enciodes, but her true aim turns out to be mutual destruction.
Within the blazing flames, the two clan leaders drop all guards.

attributes.text: My dearest sister, you're jealous of everything I have. My authority, my standing, and my wealth.
Yet you don't know that I'm jealous of you for everything you have as well. Your romantic life, your freedom, and your future.
I often wish that we had the opportunity to trade places even though I know we can't.
To hand the Browntail clan over to you would mean our family's destruction.
Likewise, if I could live your life, it would probably be a life of failure.

attributes.content: I should've expected no less, Enciodes. Coming to this meeting with just a single bodyguard.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I'm not here to fight, and my guess is you aren't here for that either.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Hmph, I'd love to, though.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Too bad, the Browntails don't have an enormous army like the Paleroches.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Are you coming inside, Degenbrecher?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Would you like me to?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: You can if you want.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Degenbrecher, wait outside.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Are you sure about that? I don't mind at all.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: A show of good faith.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Enciodes, you hide your true thoughts well.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Good faith? You're just thinking that there's nothing I can do to you.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Or you could say I'm waiting for you to do something meaningful.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You won't be disappointed, then. Come in.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, this patch of land used to belong to the Edelweiss family.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Right. Nice house, isn't it?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: It's in a good location, with a wonderful view. It's a splendid home, indeed.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Generation after generation, the Edelweiss family has been in charge of Kjerag's texts and scriptures, and they've always enjoyed a decent relationship with the three clans. It was my grandfather who ordered this house built as a villa.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I'd heard Luca had an interest in architecture, and judging from the building's design, I dare say that even Victoria's celebrity architects would have plenty of praise for it.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Hahaha, I doubt he'd be so happy to hear your approval.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: If you like it so much, though, I could show you its original blueprints.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I will think about it.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Ratatos, now that we're sitting here to share a conversation, do you know what I'm reminded of?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: That time seven years ago.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Seven years ago... Oh.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You'd just come back from Victoria. You brought lots of things with you to develop your territory.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Then, you wanted to restore the Silverashes' seat on the Tri-Clan Council and to throw the country's gates wide open, so you came to me.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You told me that once we opened those gates, we'd have business, and the people of Kjerag would get to eat better, dress better.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: After that, you and I persuaded Arctosz and the Great Elder together, and so Kjerag's gates were flung wide open, allowing us to do business with the outside.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Those were wonderful times.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Ratatos takes a sip of her cystymilk, her words carrying a hint of nostalgia.
Those were indeed wonderful times. The Silverashes and the Browntails worked together, side-by-side, while Karlan Trade, representing Kjerag, traded with the outside world.
Capital, technology, and skilled workers flowed into Kjerag, and everything seemed to be going in the right direction.
Yet you chose to put an end to these wonderful times yourself.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Ratatos, I used to believe that you were an excellent partner.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You were a disappointment yourself, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Those wonderful times were yours, not mine. Nor was it Arctosz, and much less Kjerag's.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: In the end, only Karlan Trade lived the good life. No one else did. How is that in any way wonderful?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Still, it's too late for me to say all this. The match's been decided, and I lost.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The loser has no right to talk so loftily.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: No loser would call herself a loser, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Tell me, what do you know about my parents' deaths?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Enciodes, do you think your parents were murdered by my grandfather and Arctosz?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The investigation at the time concluded that my parents were killed in a train accident caused by Gnosis's parents.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I never believed it, though. At the time, just like the Tri-Clan Council of today, both Luca and Arctosz's father opposed my parents' industrialization plans.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I find it very hard to believe that these were not connected in any way.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: In that case, let me tell you the truth.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The truth is that your parents did indeed die in a train accident. The only difference is that my grandfather framed the Edelweisses.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Hold on. I'm not done yet.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: My grandfather had actually been planning to have your parents killed.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: This house was prepared so that your parents could be burned alive inside during their visit.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Alas, they died on their way here.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: And so this place, meant to be their tomb, was spared.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Right, Arctosz's father acquiesced to my grandfather's plan too.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: And, as you know, a few years after your parents' passing, Arctosz's old man passed his clan's title over to him and went off somewhere.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Nobody knows if he's still alive.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I assume you didn't invite me here just to boast, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I never imagined this woud happen, you see. I didn't want anything to do with my grandfather's dealings.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Yet, in the end, the house where he was going to murder your parents is now where you and I will die together.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: That is indeed ironic.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Two bargaining chips for your life. I'd say it's a fair deal.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Ratatos pulls the handle by her right hand.
A chorus of mechanical sounds can be heard from beyond the ceiling and walls.
Almost like sharp laughter.
Wait... Isn't that the trap house Grandpa left behind? Why is it on fire?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Isn't she in there with Enciodes...?
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Don't tell me—She wants to die with Enciodes?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Ratatos! Hey, what are you doing? Come out, Ratatos!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Stinking bitch... Dammit... Why won't this door open no matter how many times I hack at it?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Ratatos! Rata... Ratatos—Sis!!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Dammit...!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Taking herself out with him, huh...? I see. That's an unexpected one.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Hm? You're... Ratatos's sister?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Who are you?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: You... You're the one who's always following Enciodes around...
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: You'll stand in my way?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Wait! Who gave you permission to move? Stop, all of you!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: What is it? Here for a little chat?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Why would I want a chat with you?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Let's cut the crap. Do you have any way through this door?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough*...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: It's so loud outside...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: After all these years, his trap still worked perfectly.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I thought your next move would be to escape while I was distracted.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If I was could run, wouldn't that mean that you could get away too?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: There's no way out in this room. Once it's activated, everyone inside is as good as dead.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: It won't be easy for anyone outside to break in and help, either.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Please, I beg you, Enciodes. Die with me here. You'll have me go out with you.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: It's my time to wonder, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What is it that drove you to go this far just to stop me?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Everyone always says that, just like Old Luca, Ratatos cares for nothing but profit. Sure, I am his granddaughter, how could I not?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I started working with you because I had my eyes on the riches that trade with the outside world could get us. In the end, you and Karlan Trade gobbled up all the profits.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: That's why I was going to crush Karlan Trade through the Great Elder. That way, I could take the lucre for myself.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: That's what everyone thinks. That's been my reputation the past couple years.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: And you think the same way.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I won't argue that.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: My grandfather always wanted to make the Browntails the greatest clan in Kjerag.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: That's what separates the two of us.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Right before he died, he summoned me to his deathbed, and loudly mocked Arctosz's old man for being a coward.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Then, he told me to swallow both your family and the Paleroches whole.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The way I see it, Arctosz's dad was a more decent human being.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I agree.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And I also think that even if the Browntails became the only clan in Kjerag, the people wouldn't call themselves Browntails anyway.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Kjerag is called Kjerag is because Kjeragandr herself named this place so.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Because our faith stood in these lands for over a thousand years.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: But, look at us now. It's been several hundred years since the clans started to manage their own lands.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Before you came back, all the Tri-Clan Council ever discussed was each year's events and which family would foot a bigger portion of the ceremony's bill.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: We stand on the same lands, we speak the same language, eat the same food, and believe in the same Goddess...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Yet we grew further and further apart because we belonged to different clans, and the truth is that's how we differentiate ourselves.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Kjeragandr's still in the people's hearts, but the Kjerag name is slowly being forgotten.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: When you came back to Kjerag and told me about your plans to open the borders, I was really happy.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I was happy because you told me that not only will the Silverashes trade with the other countries, you wanted the other clans to join. I thought that could bring all three families together.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Enciodes shifts his posture. Anyone who knows him knows this means he is listening attentively.
Karlan Trade trades with the outside world as the Silverash family business. It's naturally a different beast from operating it as Kjerag's window to the outside world.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And I've actually considered uniting the three clans myself.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You have? *Cough*.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I studied up on economics quite a bit to figure out what it is you were doing.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You lowered the tax rate to lure foreign capital and gave them special treatment.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: To keep the money flowing, you signed all kinds of unequal trade agreements with those big corporations.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: And, you should know, I knew you were building factories to shore up the military. You were never going to be able to hide that from me.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Do you think I called it quits because I had my eyes on your money?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I was scared.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I couldn't see anything that suggested you were going to unite the three cans. All I could see was you trying to turn Kjerag into something of your own. That, or somebody else's.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: If the choice is between you and the Great Elder, I choose the Great Elder every time.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I have to admit that I have misjudged you, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If you're opening up to me, I may as well tell you a little about this.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Kjerag may be rich in minerals and other raw resources, but, crucially, we lack any technology of our own.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: This places us at a disadvantage when it comes to technological trade.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Some technologies can be bought with money, while others cannot.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Do you know what that means?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: For example, the rights to operate the Mount Karlan trade route bought us an entire set of last generation railway signals, as well as the right of first offer for soon-to-be-retired railcars.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Without these, we'd have to rely on what my parents left us with. The old tracks and a railcar fleet over a decade old. They were practically useless for both industrial or civilian transportation.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: As another example, we traded the collaborative mining rights to the eastern mines for Rim Billiton's ore smelting technology and equipment.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Do you know how much more efficient our processes became thanks to this technology?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I don't care what you managed to trade, Enciodes. I care about what you gave them.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: We are out of time, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Be it Victoria, Minos, Columbia, or Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: The only reason they haven't yet laid their fingers on Kjerag is that they don't have to.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: In earlier times, before nomadic cities were invented, when men were sent scrambling across the world by Catastrophes, the different cultures that had been broken up all across the lands knew little about one another.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Modern nations had yet to be established, and there were no communications or contact between them.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Then, the age of innovation came two hundred years ago. It was still a time when everyone focused only on their own development, rarely making contact with one another.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: However, fast forward to a few decades ago, the nations in the world gradually began making contact and clashing.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: With Gaul's support, Columbia declared its independence from Victoria.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: However, barely a decade after that, the Battle of the Four Emperors led to Gaul's destruction.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Columbia and Leithanien's war over Bolívar continues to this day.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Not only that, but the conflicts between nations sped up their communications with one another. Countries began to enter into trade agreements, establishing trading companies in each other's territories...
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: None of them could keep themselves isolated anymore, and they all began to find ways to get along with the other nations.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And when all of this was happening, Kjerag was completely oblivious.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And now that the danger is at our doorstep, we're still oblivious.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Victoria is busy with its own mess. Columbia's pioneering efforts are nearing its western mountain ranges.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: For a long time, Kjerag has been nothing but a barren, impoverished territory not worthy of occupation.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: But if Victoria solves its internal problems, if Columbia has any ideas about Victoria, or even if Kazimierz wants to head south.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: When the time comes, do you think Kjerag will still be able to enjoy peace?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Hey, I'm talking to you! A-Are you even listening?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Look, I'm begging you! Do you have a way to bust open this stinking door?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: How clamorous.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: What was that?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Pipe down, and don't come too close. You'll ruin my uniform.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Is now the time to worry about that?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Degenbrecher shoves Sciurus, who is tugging her hem, to the side and walks toward the small house where Enciodes and Ratatos sit.
All of the windows have been sealed shut with metal plates.
And there is a thick wall right in front of her.
This is your clan's. Are you sure you don't want to stop me?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Why the hell would I?! Do it already!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Degenbrecher grins a little and cuts through the wall with ease.
Then, she lightly kicks the wall, sending what appeared to be an indestructible barrier collapsing onto the ground like a child's toy.
The only thing that serves as a testament to its tremendous mass is the loud bang that can be heard when the wall crashes to the floor.
However, Degenbrecher doesn't seem satisfied with the result.
If I knew this would happen, I would have ignored Enciodes and thrown my old buddy into the storeroom.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: It's too much of a pain to do this with a sword.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: The bodyguard tosses her blade aside and pulls her namesake swordbreakers from her waist.
The wall crumbles like a sheet of paper through a shredder.
The flames are spreading throughout the room, engulfing everything in their path.
Yet the room's two occupants seem completely unconcerned about what's happening around them.
It is as though they can't feel any of the heat, or perhaps they themselves are burning even hotter than the flames around them.
I have to admit that I never expected you to feel this way about Kjerag.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If our conversation had happened sooner, things would not have come to this.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: But it seems this must have been inevitable.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Were it not for the situation we are in, we would never have had this heart-to-heart.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Hmph, you got that right.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Inevitable.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Right, inevitable.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: And if it's so inevitable, we might as well go meet Kjeragandr together.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Ratatos is starting to feel exhausted. Her vision begins to cloud.
In a trance, she sees her young self, playing with her baby sister and a boy.
She sees herself amazed by the wondrous sight of railroads and factories.

They are all moments to which she can no longer return. She shakes her head. Enciodes, sitting opposite her, has maintained his posture throughout. Be that as it may, she is no longer able to clearly make out his face.
Sure enough, he'll act so calm even at a time like this.
Even so, he'll die here all the same. Heh.
Her consciousness is slipping further and further. Just as she is about to slip away completely, she hears a thunderous roar.
And with it, a familiar voice.
Ratatos!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Time to go, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Hff—
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Ratatos, you're finally awake!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: I'm alive?!
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You'll never die with Degenbrecher around.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: So our trap house, the pride of the Browntails, couldn't stop you, huh?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The wall itself wasn't a problem, but it was a pain to find your room.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Why save me?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I'm here to accept the Browntails' surrender, not to claim the head of their master.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I only said that to lure you here... and now that you kept me alive, you should know I'm not going let you have the Browntails under your thumb.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes... It's Sir Enciodes!
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner A

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes, did you really escape from a burning house?
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner B

attributes.content: Ratatos... She's the one who did this, isn't she?!
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner A

attributes.content: Don't worry about her. Quick, find us a coat.
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner B

attributes.content: Take mine. Sir Enciodes, take my coat!
attributes.name: Kjerag Noble

attributes.content: A nobleman from among the crowd ardently removes his coat. He then courteously walks up to Enciodes and puts the coat over his shoulders.
However, Enciodes takes the coat off and walks over to Ratatos, who is sitting on the ground, to put the coat on her instead.
Then, without saying another word, he stands up and heads for his car, parked on the side of the road.
Not only did he not arrest Ratatos, he gave her the coat... He is far too generous!
attributes.name: Kjerag Noble

attributes.content: Hey, Ratatos's here. Should we, you know...?
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner A

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes just spared her! I'm not sure that's a good idea.
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner B

attributes.content: What do you know? Sir Enciodes is giving us this opportunity!
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner A

attributes.content: What do you think you're doing?
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Hmph, Sciurus, huh? Don't worry. We'll take care of you too.
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner A

attributes.content: Scram! All of you!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Gah, this bitch is nuts!
attributes.name: Kjerag Commoner A

attributes.content: Hey, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Ratatos!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Snap out of it. We gotta move!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: To where? Where can we go?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Look around us. They're all Browntail subjects.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Can't you tell, just looking at their eyes?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I've lost everything.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Grr...
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Looks like I got here too late.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: You... You're the one who saved me and Arctosz.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: So even you come to laugh in my face?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: No, the Doctor would like to have a chat with you.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: I'll pass...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Looking where we've ended up, what good would that bring us?
attributes.name: Ratatos
